business.headline: New PPF rules effective October 1: What you need to knowThe new rules aim to streamline the management of PPF accounts, particularly for minors, individuals with multiple accounts, and Non-Resident Indians (NRIs). Here's a closer look at the changes and what they mean for investors.

Stock market changes from October 1: What investors need to knowThe changes include revised transaction charges by stock exchanges, an increase in Securities Transaction Tax (STT), and new taxation rules governing share buybacks.

Bloodbath on D-Street: Sensex slips 1,200 points; investors lose Rs 4 lakh croreThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 1,272.07 points to 84,299.78 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 361.65 points lower at 25,810.85.

Ola Electric shares slip below Rs 100. Buy the dip or avoid? The stock was down 2.59% at Rs 99.55 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), marking a sharp decline from its record high of Rs 157.53 on August 20, 2024.

Indian Oil Corporation withdraws Rs 22,000 crore rights issueIOC decided to withdraw the rights issue following the Ministry of Petroleum & Natural Gas (MoP&NG) informing that no funds have been allocated for capital support to Oil Marketing Companies (OMCs) in the 2024-25 budget.

Sebi board meeting today. What's on the agenda?On the agenda are discussions surrounding tighter norms for Futures & Options (F&O) trading, the introduction of a 'New Asset Class,' and the much-anticipated mutual fund lite regulations.

Manba Finance lists at 25% premium over IPO price. Hold or sell? Will Manba Finance shares continue to rise after listing on Dalal Street or is it time to cash in on your gains? Here's all you need to know.

KRN Heat Exchanger IPO allotment: Step-by-Step guide to check statusKRN Heat Exchanger IPO allotment: Investors who participated in the KRN Heat Exchanger IPO can check their allotment status through the websites of the Bombay Stock Exchange and Bigshare Services.

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points. What's making D-Street bulls nervous?Stock market crash: The Sensex was down 1,018.81 points to 84,553.04 at 11:50 am and the Nifty50 tanked 290.20 points to trade at 25,888.75.

Ashneer Grover settles with BharatPe after ugly legal battle, ends ties to firmThe resolution comes after a tumultuous period marked by allegations of financial misconduct against Ashneer Grover and his family during his tenure at BharatPe.

Mark Zuckerberg becomes world's fourth-richest person, enters $200 billion clubMark Zuckerberg's net worth has surged to $200 billion, positioning him as the fourth-richest person globally, right behind Amazon founder Jeff Bezos,, Tesla CEO Elon Musk and LVMH Chairman Bernard Arnault.
Income tax audit report deadline extended to October 7. Who benefits? Income tax audit report deadline: Originally set for September 30, 2024, the new deadline is now October 7, 2024.
Manba Finance shares list at 25% premium over IPO priceManba Finance IPO listing: Despite making a decent debut on the stock exchanges, the listing fell short of what the GMP had indicated.
Sensex slumps 700 points, Nifty falls below 26,000 amid profit bookingThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 685.85 points to 84,886 at 10:14 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 191.60 points to 25,987.35.

Modi vs Modi: The succession war brewing at Godfrey PhillipsAs the legal showdown unfolds, it's Modi vs Modi in a gripping battle that tests family bonds and determines the future of Godfrey Phillips India, highlighting ambition, legacy, and loyalty.

Meet Alakh Pandey, the young Edtech visionary behind Physics WallahFrom a humble tutor to a trailblazing entrepreneur, Alakh Pandey's journey with Physics Wallah shows how passion and perseverance can turn even the simplest beginnings into a $2.8 billion empire—reshaping education, one formula at a time.
Akriti Chopra, Zomato co-founder and Chief People's Officer, resignsIn an email to Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal, Akriti Chopra announced her decision to resign with immediate effect.
Explained: Why SJVN shares gained over 6% todayThe stock rose 6.03% to Rs 133.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), with a market capitalisation of Rs 52,520 crore.
Sensex, Nifty end lower after hitting record highs as financial stocks fallThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 264.27 points lower at 85,571.85, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 37.10 points lower at 26,178.95.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: ED files money laundering case against Siddaramaiah in land 'scam'While taking cognisance of a recent state Lokayukta FIR, the central probe agency has filed an enforcement case information report (ECIR) to book Siddaramaiah and others.

Tirupati laddu: Why go to press without proof on ghee, Supreme Court asks Andhra"At least, the Gods should be kept away from politics," the Supreme Court said, questioning Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu's public statement on laddus when an investigation had already been ordered.

Work pressure, threat of salary deduction: Bajaj Finance staff dies by suicide In a suicide note, Tarun Saxena stated that his seniors at work have been putting pressure on him to meet his targets for the last two months and threatening him with salary deductions. However, Bajaj Finance is yet to react to the allegations.

My life back on track: Dalit student on Supreme Court's help over missed IIT seatThe Supreme Court on Monday ordered IIT Dhanbad to grant admission to a Dalit student who lost his seat after missing the deadline to deposit the fee.

Why Sunita Williams cannot return from Space on Dragon immediatelyThe SpaceX Crew-9 mission, carrying NASA astronaut Nick Hague and Roscosmos cosmonaut Alexander Gorbunov, was specifically launched to provide a safe return option for Williams and Wilmore.

Ground Report: Rescue teams race to find survivors after Israeli strike in LebanonRescue teams, racing against time, are digging through the debris, hoping to find survivors. While the chances of discovering anyone alive seem slim, the search continues with urgency.

High Court pauses probe against Nirmala Sitharaman in electoral bonds caseObserving that there was no direct threat against the complainant, the Karnataka High Court on Monday issued a pause on the probe related to the electoral bond extortion case.

India play Bazball Pro Max in shortened Kanpur Test in bid to force resultIndia vs Bangladesh, Kanpur Test: India scored 8.22 runs per over, breaking a series of word records in a bid to force a favourable result in the rain-curtailed Test. R Ashwin weaved magic with the new ball as Bangladesh ended the day at 26 for 2, still trailing India's total by 26 runs on Monday.
Your period lasts only two days. Should you be worried?The fact that your period lasts just two days makes you anxious? Here's what you might need to know.

Theft of donations at Bengaluru temple caught on camera, sparks outrageSeveral videos of individuals stealing donations during the counting process at a Bengaluru temple, which went viral, have sparked outrage, prompting a police investigation.
How Israel struck Hezbollah, took out Nasrallah: Timeline of Lebanon assaultThe fighting killed several top Hezbollah officials and over 1,000 people in Lebanon.

600 Kerala Christian families flag Waqf board's 'unlawful claims' on propertiesThe Syro-Malabar Church and the Kerala Catholic Bishops Council (KCBC) approached the Joint Parliamentary Committee regarding the Waqf (Amendment) Bill 2024.

Once upon a tram... Now, Kolkata bids a teary farewellTrams once plied across most cities in India, but it was Kolkata that held onto its slowness. If the Victoria Memorial defines Kolkata's skyscape, the trams came to become a marker of its cityscape. After clutching onto trams for 151 years, Kolkata is bidding adieu to it. Tracing the tram journey in images.

New PPF rules effective October 1: What you need to knowThe new rules aim to streamline the management of PPF accounts, particularly for minors, individuals with multiple accounts, and Non-Resident Indians (NRIs). Here's a closer look at the changes and what they mean for investors.

Stock market changes from October 1: What investors need to knowThe changes include revised transaction charges by stock exchanges, an increase in Securities Transaction Tax (STT), and new taxation rules governing share buybacks.

Israel's battle for survival sees 3 of 5 war fronts scorching nowA year since the October 7 attack by Hamas, Israel is now fighting for its existence on three of its five war fronts. It is battling Hamas in the Gaza Strip, Hezbollah in Lebanon and Houthi rebels in Yemen. But Israel is just dealing with Iran's proxy groups for now, and the war could escalate massively if Iran joins in directly.

Someone recreated the classic hare and tortoise story IRL and the video is viralThe Aesop's classic fable of the tortoise and the hare just got real when a video of people recreating the story went viral on social media.

Kanpur fiasco adds fuel to call for designated Test cricket centres in IndiaIndia vs Bangladesh, 2nd Test: Questions have been raised over the lack of modern facilities at Green Park in Kanpur after two full days of Test cricket were washed out due to a wet outfield. The fiasco has reignited the debate about whether India should adopt a system of designated Test centres.

Hezbollah deputy's message as Israel wipes out top command: We have replacementsHezbollah's deputy leader Naim Kassem said that the militant group was prepared for a long war after top leaders were wiped out, including its chief, Hassan Nasrallah.

Hezbollah pager blasts: International warrant for Kerala-born businessman A Kerala-born Norwegian businessman, Rinson Jose, whose name had come up in the Hezbollah exploding-pagers case, has gone missing. This has prompted authorities in  Norway to issue an international warrant for his arrest. Jose's Bulgaria-based firm was previously investigated for supplying pagers to Hezbollah, which were later detonated in Lebanon, causing at least 30 casualties.

Disguised as tourist, woman cop takes late-night auto ride in Agra. And then...A woman cop disguised herself as a tourist and took a late-night auto ride to test the emergency services in Agra. Read on to know what happened next.

Maharashtra declares indigenous cows 'Rajyamata-Gomata' ahead of pollsThe state Cabinet led by Chief Minister Eknath Shinde decided that native cow breeds should be given the status of 'Rajyamata-Gomata' (state mother cow) for their cultural and agricultural significance.

Satellite pics show smoke and ruins at site of Hezbollah chief's killingDays after the attack in which Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah was killed, satellite images showed the extent of destruction on the group's central command headquarters in Beirut.

India break world record for fastest team fifty and hundred in Test cricketIndia vs Bangladesh: Team India broke the record for fastest team fifty and fastest team hundred by getting there in three overs and ten overs respectively during day four of the second Test in Kanpur on Monday.

Actor Jayam Ravi's wife Aarti: My silence is not a sign of weakness or guiltAarti Ravi has addressed the ongoing public commentary on her personal life, particularly her divorce from actor Jayam Ravi. She emphasised her commitment to dignity and clarified her stance on the matter.

Rajinikanth's Vettaiyan trailer to release on October 2. See new posterThe trailer for Rajinikanth's Vettaiyan is set to release on October 2, and it will be available in four languages. The film also stars Amitabh Bachchan.

Mrunal Thakur on winning Best Actor for Hi Nanna at IIFA Utsavam: Deeply gratefulActor Mrunal Thakur won the Best Actor award at the IIFA Utsavam for her role in the Telugu film, Hi Nanna. She expressed gratitude towards her director, co-stars, and the entire team for their support.

Raa Macha Macha: Game Changer's second song is certified party anthemThe second song from the highly anticipated film, Game Changer, starring Ram Charan and Kiara Advani, has been unveiled. Titled Raa Macha Macha, the energetic track promises to be the ultimate party anthem of the season.

sports.headline: Shan Masood rules out major changes, backs players for England Tests PAK vs ENG: Shan Masood said that Pakistan should try and stay optimistic amid their dismal run in Test cricket. After losing to Bangladesh at home, Masood's men will face England in a three-match series.

Dembele dropped from PSG squad for Arsenal after Enrique fallout: ReportsOusmane Dembele's exclusion from PSG's Champions League clash against Arsenal, following a fallout with coach Luis Enrique, raises questions about his future at the club, as PSG faces one of their biggest tests of the season.

Stat Pack: Rohit Sharma's India plunder records in Kanpur Test IND vs BAN: India showed intent on Day 4 of the Kanpur Test as they made 285 for nine in 34.4 overs in the first innings. Rohit Sharma, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Virat Kohli and KL Rahul put the opposition batters under pressure by batting aggressively.

India play Bazball Pro Max in shortened Kanpur Test in bid to force resultIndia vs Bangladesh, Kanpur Test: India scored 8.22 runs per over, breaking a series of word records in a bid to force a favourable result in the rain-curtailed Test. R Ashwin weaved magic with the new ball as Bangladesh ended the day at 26 for 2, still trailing India's total by 26 runs on Monday.

Government will decide on India's travel to Pak for Champions Trophy: BCCIBCCI's stance on India's participation in the 2025 ICC Champions Trophy in Pakistan remains undecided, as any tour will depend on government approval. Speculations grew that the BCCI might push for the tournament to be relocated elsewhere.

Mehidy Hasan Miraz becomes 4th Bangladesh bowler with 300 wickets IND vs BAN: Mehidy Hasan Miraz had figures of 6.4-0-41-4 in the first innings of the Kanpur Test. He dismissed Akash Deep to join Mashrafe Mortaza, Shakib Al Hasan and Mustafizur Rahman in the elite list of Bangladeshi bowlers with 300 wickets.

Did Akash Deep hit sixes with Kohli's bat? Fans speculate after Kanpur cameoAkash Deep sent the fans into frenzy with his two sixes on Day 4 of the 2nd Test between India and Bangladesh in Kanpur. The fans speculated if this was the same bat which Kohli gifted him after the 1st Test.

IND vs BAN: Michael Vaughan says India playing Bazball, fans troll England legendMichael Vaughan got trolled by fans as he claimed that India was playing Bazball in Kanpur against Bangladesh on Monday, September 30. India batters put the Bangladeshi bowlers to the sword with their aggressive batting.

IND vs BAN: KL Rahul shuts critics with quickfire fifty on Day 4 in KanpurKL Rahul shut down his critics with a quickfire fifty on Day 4 of the 2nd Test between India and Bangladesh in Kanpur. This was Rahul's fastest and 15th Test fifty for India in whites.

The fiasco has reignited the debate about whether India should adopt a system of designated Test centres.

Virat Kohli becomes fastest batter to 27000 international runsIndia batting maestro Virat Kohli became the fourth batter and the fastest to complete 27,000 international runs during the second Test against Bangladesh in Kanpur.

India batters put the Bangladeshi bowlers to the sword with their aggressive batting.

The fiasco has reignited the debate about whether India should adopt a system of designated Test centres.

Virat Kohli becomes fastest batter to 27000 international runsIndia batting maestro Virat Kohli became the fourth batter and the fastest to complete 27,000 international runs during the second Test against Bangladesh in Kanpur.

Rohit Sharma's 'refreshing' captaincy thrills Saba Karim: No half-measuresSaba Karim was in awe of Rohit Sharma's captaincy as the Indian skipper went on a rampage on Day 4 of the Kanpur Test on Monday, September 30. Rohit set the tone by hitting 2 sixes from the very first 2 balls he faced.

Rishabh Pant hugs Virat Kohli after Bangladesh botch up easy run outIND vs BAN: Virat Kohli hugged Rishabh Pant after he survived a run-out on Day 4 of the second Test against Bangladesh at the Green Park in Kanpur.

Disrespect towards Virat Kohli: Fans upset with Rishabh Pant's promotion in KanpurA certain section of fans was upset with Rishabh Pant's promotion to No. 4 position over Virat Kohli during the Day 4 of the 2nd Test between India and Bangladesh.

France's Griezmann announces shock retirement from international footballAntoine Griezmann shocked the football world by announcing his international retirement, capping off an illustrious seven-year journey with France that included a World Cup triumph and unforgettable moments on the global stage.

Watch: Rohit Sharma loses cool after LBW call, gets out next delivery in KanpurIndia vs Bangladesh, Kanpur Test: Rohit Sharma was seen punching the air in anger after an LBW decision against him was overturned. Rohit was seemingly upset with break in momentum after he gave India a rapid start in their first innings on Monday.

India top England to clinch most Test sixes in a calendar yearIndia has shattered England's record for the most Test sixes in a calendar year, with 90 sixes in just 14 innings. Led by Rohit Sharma, India's aggressive batting is rewriting Test cricket's boundaries in 2024.

India break world record for fastest team fifty and hundred in Test cricketIndia vs Bangladesh: Team India broke the record for fastest team fifty and fastest team hundred by getting there in three overs and ten overs respectively during day four of the second Test in Kanpur on Monday.

Kanpur Test: Rohit Sharma in T20 mode, starts innings with 3 massive sixesIndia captain Rohit Sharma was in T20 mode as the opener hit 3 sixes to start his innings in the Kanpur Test on Monday, September 30.

Watch: Rohit Sharma loses cool after LBW call, gets out next delivery in KanpurIndia vs Bangladesh, Kanpur Test: Rohit Sharma was seen punching the air in anger after an LBW decision against him was overturned. Rohit was seemingly upset with break in momentum after he gave India a rapid start in their first innings on Monday.

India break world record for fastest team fifty and hundred in Test cricketIndia vs Bangladesh: Team India broke the record for fastest team fifty and fastest team hundred by getting there in three overs and ten overs respectively during day four of the second Test in Kanpur on Monday.

Kanpur Test: Rohit Sharma in T20 mode, starts innings with 3 massive sixesIndia captain Rohit Sharma was in T20 mode as the opener hit 3 sixes to start his innings in the Kanpur Test on Monday, September 30.

Ravindra Jadeja emulates Kapil Dev, Ashwin with 3000 runs-300 wickets Test doubleRavindra Jadeja emulated Kapil Dev and R Ashwin with his 300th Test wicket to complete an elite double on September 30, Monday.

Hitting hundred or playing rugby: Ireland's T20I hero Ross Adair reveals pickRoss Adair revealed his pick between scoring a hundred in cricket or playing Rugby after his heroics with the bat in the 2nd T20I against South Africa on Sunday, September 29.

Cuadrat resigns as East Bengal FC coach after horror start to ISL campaignCarles Cuadrat stepped down from his role as East Bengal FC manager on September 30, after the side's horrific start to their Indian Super League 2024-25 campaign. Cuadrat joined the side in 2023, and went on to guide the side to their Kalinga Super Cup triumph.

Kanpur Test catch will motivate Rohit Sharma to run an extra lap: Tamim IqbalIndia vs Bangladesh: Bangladesh opener Tamim Iqbal praised Rohit Sharma's effort on the field after the India captain took a sensational one-handed catch. Tamim said Rohit worked hard on his fitness in the lead-up to India's home cricket season.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
